H0.text: Oil is the source from which gasoline, a nonrenewable energy resource used in most cars and trucks, is made.

H1.text: Hydrogen is the source from which gasoline, a nonrenewable energy resource used in most cars and trucks, is made.

H2.text: Natural gas is the source from which gasoline, a nonrenewable energy resource used in most cars and trucks, is made.

H3.text: Water vapor is the source from which gasoline is made, a nonrenewable energy resource used in most cars and trucks.

A4.text: The alkanes from pentane (C5H12) to octane (C8H18) are refined into gasoline.

A5.text: Petroleum products include fuels such as gasoline (petrol), diesel, kerosene and jet fuel; bitumen, paraffin wax and lubricants; reagents used to make plastics; solvents, textiles, refrigerants, paint, synthetic rubber, fertilizers, pesticides, pharmaceuticals, and thousands of other petrochemicals.
